segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3
8. Ānanda
72. A Disciple of the Ājīvakas

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ānando kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho aññataro ājīvakasāvako gahapati yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so ājīvakasāvako gahapati āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then a householder who was a disciple of the Ājīvaka ascetics went up to Venerable Ānanda, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to Ānanda:
“Sir, whose teaching is well explained?
Who in the world is practicing well?
Who in the world has done well?”

segments.pli: “Tena hi, gahapati, taññevettha paṭipucchissāmi, yathā te khameyya tathā naṃ byākareyyāsi.
segments.en: “Well then, householder, I’ll ask you about this in return, and you can answer as you like.
What do you think, householder?

segments.pli: ye rāgassa pahānāya dhammaṃ desenti, dosassa pahānāya dhammaṃ desenti, mohassa pahānāya dhammaṃ desenti, tesaṃ dhammo svākkhāto no vā?
segments.en: Is the teaching of those who teach for giving up greed, hate, and delusion well explained or not?
Or how do you see this?”

segments.pli: “Ye, bhante, rāgassa pahānāya dhammaṃ desenti, dosassa pahānāya dhammaṃ desenti, mohassa pahānāya dhammaṃ desenti, tesaṃ dhammo svākkhāto.
segments.en: “The teaching of those who teach for giving up greed, hate, and delusion is well explained.
That’s how I see it.”
“What do you think, householder?

segments.pli: ye rāgassa pahānāya paṭipannā, dosassa pahānāya paṭipannā, mohassa pahānāya paṭipannā, te loke suppaṭipannā no vā?
segments.en: Are those who practice for giving up greed, hate, and delusion practicing well or not?
Or how do you see this?”

segments.pli: “Ye, bhante, rāgassa pahānāya paṭipannā, dosassa pahānāya paṭipannā, mohassa pahānāya paṭipannā, te loke suppaṭipannā.
segments.en: “Those who practice for giving up greed, hate, and delusion are practicing well.
That’s how I see it.”
“What do you think, householder?

segments.pli: yesaṃ rāgo pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo, yesaṃ doso pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo, yesaṃ moho pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo, te loke sukatā no vā?
segments.en: Have those who’ve given up greed, hate, and delusion—so they’re cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future—done well in the world, or not?
Or how do you see this?”

segments.pli: “Yesaṃ, bhante, rāgo pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo, yesaṃ doso pahīno … pe … yesaṃ moho pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo, te loke sukatā.
segments.en: “Those who’ve given up greed, hate, and delusion have done well in the world.
That’s how I see it.”
“So, householder, you’ve declared:

segments.pli: ‘ye, bhante, rāgassa pahānāya dhammaṃ desenti, dosassa pahānāya dhammaṃ desenti, mohassa pahānāya dhammaṃ desenti, tesaṃ dhammo svākkhāto’ti.
segments.en: ‘The teaching of those who teach for giving up greed, hate, and delusion is well explained.’
And you’ve declared:

segments.pli: ‘ye, bhante, rāgassa pahānāya paṭipannā, dosassa pahānāya paṭipannā, mohassa pahānāya paṭipannā, te loke suppaṭipannā’ti.
segments.en: ‘Those who practice for giving up greed, hate, and delusion are practicing well.’
And you’ve declared:

segments.pli: ‘yesaṃ, bhante, rāgo pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṃkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo, yesaṃ doso pahīno … pe … yesaṃ moho pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṃkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo, te loke sukatā’”ti.
segments.en: ‘Those who’ve given up greed, hate, and delusion have done well in the world.’”
“It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing!

segments.pli: Na ceva nāma sadhammukkaṃsanā bhavissati, na ca paradhammāpasādanā.
segments.en: There’s no acclaiming your own teaching or disrespecting someone else’s,

segments.pli: Āyataneva dhammadesanā, attho ca vutto, attā ca anupanīto.
segments.en: just teaching what’s relevant in that context. The goal is spoken of, but the self is not involved.

segments.pli: Tumhe, bhante ānanda, rāgassa pahānāya dhammaṃ desetha, dosassa … pe … mohassa pahanāya dhammaṃ desetha.
segments.en: You, sir, teach Dhamma for giving up greed, hate, and delusion.
Your teaching is well explained.

segments.pli: Tumhe, bhante ānanda, rāgassa pahānāya paṭipannā, dosassa … pe … mohassa pahānāya paṭipannā.
segments.en: You, sir, practice for giving up greed, hate, and delusion.
You in the world are practicing well.

segments.pli: Tumhākaṃ, bhante ānanda, rāgo pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṃkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo, tumhākaṃ doso pahīno … pe … tumhākaṃ moho pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṃkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo.
segments.en: You’ve given up greed, hate, and delusion.
You in the world have done well.
Excellent, sir! Excellent!

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṃ ayyena ānandena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
segments.en: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there, Venerable Ānanda has made the teaching clear in many ways.

segments.pli: Esāhaṃ, bhante ānanda, taṃ bhagavantaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
segments.en: I go for refuge to the Buddha, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Upāsakaṃ maṃ ayyo ānando dhāretu, ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
segments.en: From this day forth, may Venerable Ānanda remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
